title-part.text: CHEMICAL COMPOSITION OF GLASSES, GLAZES, OR VITREOUS ENAMELS
SURFACE TREATMENT OF FIBRES OR FILAMENTS FROM GLASS, MINERALS OR SLAGS
JOINING GLASS TO GLASS OR OTHER MATERIALS

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers compositions of polycristalline fibres
This subclass does not cover the preparation of single-cristal fibres, which is covered by subclass C30B

The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
C03C6/00 covered by C03C1/00
C03C10/02-C03C10/14 covered by C03C10/00
C03C13/02 covered by C03C13/00
C03C27/12 covered by B32B17/00

title-part.text: Chemical composition of glasses, glazes, or vitreous enamels

note.note-paragraph: In groups C03C1/00 to C03C14/00, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the last appropriate place.

title-part.text: Ingredients generally applicable to manufacture of glasses, glazes, or vitreous enamels

CPC-specific-text.text: Use of waste materials, e.g. slags
to produce glass through wet route
for the production of films or coatings
Purification of silica sand or other minerals
Chemical treatment of cullet or glass fibres
Pelletisation or prereacting of powdered raw materials
Ingredients allowing introduction of lead or other easily volatile or dusty compounds

title-part.text: to produce non-uniformly pigmented, e.g. speckled, marbled, or veined products

CPC-specific-text.text: by the addition of colorants to the forehearth of the glass melting furnace

note.note-paragraph: If silica is specified as being present in a percent range covered by two of the groups C03C3/06, C03C3/062 or C03C3/076, classification is made in both groups. If the range is covered by the three groups, classification is made in group C03C3/04 itself.

title-part.text: with less than 40% silica by weight

containing aluminium oxide or an iron compound
containing an oxide of a divalent metal
containing calcium oxide, e.g. common sheet or container glass

containing titanium, zirconium, vanadium, tungsten or molybdenum

CPC-specific-text.text: Chalcogenide glasses, e.g. containing S, Se, Te

title-part.text: Compositions for glass with special properties

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in group C03C4/00, classification is also made in the appropriate groups of group C03C3/00 according to the glass composition.

for soluble glass for controlled release of a compound incorporated in said glass

with vehicle or suspending agents, e.g. slip
containing two or more distinct frits having different compositions
Fusion seal compositions being frit compositions having non-frit additions, i.e. for use as seals between dissimilar materials, e.g. glass and metal

CPC-specific-text.text: containing more than 50% lead oxide, by weight

title-part.text: Devitrified glass ceramics, i.e. glass ceramics having a crystalline phase dispersed in a glassy phase and constituting at least 50% by weight of the total composition

CPC-specific-text.text: containing SiO2, Al2O3 and monovalent metal oxide as main constituents
containing SiO2, Al2O3, Li2O as main constituents
containing SiO2, Al2O3 and a divalent metal oxide as main constituents
containing SiO2, Al2O3 and MgO as main constituents
Porous or hollow glass or glass particles
obtained by leaching after a phase separation step
Foam glass, e.g. obtained by incorporating a blowing agent and heating

reference.text: manufacture of fibres or filaments C03B37/00

CPC-specific-text.text: obtained by leaching of a soluble phase and consolidation

title-part.text: Fibre optics, e.g. core and clad fibre compositions

title-part.text: Mineral fibres, e.g. slag wool, mineral wool, rock wool
Glass compositions containing a non-glass component, e.g. compositions containing fibres, filaments, whiskers, platelets, or the like, dispersed in a glass matrix

the non-glass component being in molecular form

reference.text: optical coatings of optical elements G02B1/10

by deposition from the liquid phase

by deposition from the liquid phase

with at least two coatings of inorganic materials

at least one of the coatings being a non-oxide coating

in combination with other metals, silver being more than 50%
made of metals other than silver

the multilayer coating being used for decoration purposes
the multilayer coating being used for ovens

one metallic layer being obtained by reduction of an oxide layer
one layer having a composition gradient through its thickness
one metallic layer at least being obtained by electroless plating

at least one coating of an organic material and at least one non-metal coating

to perform ion-exchange between alkali ions

to perform an exchange of the type Xn+ ----> nH+

CPC-specific-text.text: by solution impregnating; solution doping or molecular stuffing of porous glass
containing particles, fibres or flakes, e.g. in a continuous phase
Coating with colouring agent-containing compositions, e.g. for obtaining coloured textiles
Fibres used for reinforcing cement-based products
with at least one organic coating and at least one inorganic coating
Pulverisation on fibres in suspension in a gaseous medium

title-part.text: Contacting the fibres with applicators, e.g. rolls

CPC-specific-text.text: by chemical vapour deposition or pyrolysis

note-paragraph.pre: In groups C03C25/24 to C03C25/40, organic coating compositions also cover mixtures of organic and inorganic compounds. A coating composition which cannot be completely classified in a single one of groups C03C25/24 to C03C25/40 should be classified in each relevant group, in accordance with the following rules: - Compositions containing only one macromolecular constituent and one or more conventional inorganic or non-macromolecular compounds, e.g. acids, solvents, are classified according to the macromolecular constituent only. - Compositions containing two or more macromolecular constituents and further conventional inorganic or non-macromolecular compounds are classified according to the macromolecular constituent present in the highest proportion. If, however, the other macromolecular constituents represent invention information, classification is also made for these constituents. - Compositions containing macromolecular constituents present in comparable proportions are classified according to these constituents. - If non-macromolecular compounds in the composition also represent invention information, C03C25/38, for specific solvents, fillers, dyes or pigments, surfactants, biocides or the like in C03C25/24 or subgroups.

CPC-specific-text.text: Oils, waxes, fats or derivatives thereof
Non-macromolecular compounds not covered by C03C25/243

title-part.text: obtained by reactions involving only carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
obtained otherwise than by reactions involving only carbon-to-carbon unsaturated bonds
Condensation polymers of aldehydes, e.g. with phenol, ureas, melamines, amides or amines
with two or more coatings having different compositions

note.note-paragraph: If one or more of the individual coatings are of interest, for each of these coatings classification is also made in one or more of groups C03C25/24 to C03C25/46, in accordance with the note before group C03C25/24.

title-part.text: Combinations of one or more coatings containing organic materials only with one or more coatings containing inorganic materials only
by diffusing ions or metals in the surface

under application of an electrical potential difference

in the solid phase, e.g. using pastes, powders

Joining glass to glass or to other materials

note.note-paragraph: Layered products classified in groups C03C27/00 or C03C29/00 are also classified in subclass B32B.

Joining glass to glass other than by fusing

with the aid of adhesive specially adapted for that purpose

note.note-paragraph: This code is only to be used in combination with C03C classification symbols having the +IDT notation.

characterized by the composition of the continuous phase
